pros: I worked with really nice people.
cons: Moldy building, Ineffective leadership, athletes receive larger scholarships than other students.

job_title: Assistant Track and Field Coach in Winfield, KS
pros: Good COVID safety protocol in place, great athletic training staff
cons: its about the numbers for recruitment

review_title: Could be a fantastic place to work.
pros: Good benefits, rewarding work, and lots of great people. The new president seems intelligent with lots of good ideas. Employees are excited about moving the college forward.
cons: The president does not seem to hire well, so the new management team is pretty mediocre. One senior vp in particular is just a bully. Everyone pretends to like her because they are afraid they will lose their job if they speak up about how she treats people. She seems to have the trust of the president, but she consistently misrepresents the facts or just screws up and acts like others are not doing their job. I think he believes her and it is getting scary. Everyone is talking about it but we're all afraid to say anything publicly. She definitely should not be in a leadership position or supervising people.

review_title: The Leadership Team at Professional Studies need revamped.
pros: There are some nice co-workers, the benefits are pretty good, and the work is pretty simple. The pay isn't bad compared to similar jobs/organizations.
cons: The Leadership Team at PS seem to think that interrupting everyone's day with multitudes of unneccesary meetings is helpful. They also treat the employees (and generally the learners) as if they are simpletons who cannot handle basic tasks or understand simple communications. Hence the excessive need for meetings and overly long emails. And heaven forbid we expect learners to pay for our services as that is just bad customer service (sarcasm).

review_title: Overall a nice place to work.
pros: Decent salary and benefits, good working evironment with nice people, a lot of independence and ability to make decisions. Basically it is a place that you can either make your job great or mediocre. It's up to you.
cons: Some nice people who aren't very competent. Yet these are the ones who complain the most about their job. I'm not sure why people who supposedly dislike their job so much do not leave.

pros: The atmosphere at times can be relaxed.  Some of us are allowed to work from home.
cons: Management is terrible; the employees are not secure in their positions.  Secret meetings happen all the time.  There is no process to how the employees are able to move up the ladder.  Most people know when someone is getting fired weeks before that person actuality gets fired.  If you agree to help with a situation temporarily, they make it your permanent position.

pros: Working with students to tech them the ins and outs of business in todays environment.  Undergraduate students learn the basics of business management.
cons: A small college with less than 1000 students and limited funds and resources could use more money and more students.

review_title: They have a lot to learn
pros: The mission and vision in the eyes of God is strong.  The board of directors has the ability to do more than they have been informed.
cons: The Senior Leadership Team will not walk the talk.  They struggle with how to add the business acumen within a Christian organization
